dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] copy theft on http://www.ambestmedia.com/services_print.asp]
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Sunday, December 04, 2005 5:17 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; sales@1printingsource.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] copy theft on
http://www.ambestmedia.com/services_print.asp]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] copy theft on http://www.ambestmedia.com/services_print.asp
Date: Thu, 1 Dec 2005 20:23:29 -0800
From: PRINTING SOURCE, INC <sales@1printingsource.com>
To: <info@ambestmedia.com>
CC: adimns@theplanet.com, abuse@theplanet.com

It has come to our attention that you,
http://www.ambestmedia.com/services_print.asp , are using on your website
material copied verbatim from our website, www.pbdink.com (the "Property")
in spite of the fact that it is obviously our intellectual property.  As you
know or should know such misappropriation and use in competitive commerce of
our intellectual property is a clear violation of the copyright laws of the
United States of America, the Digital Millennium Copyright Act and the
unfair competition and predatory trade practices laws of both the United
States of America and the State of California.  Demand is hereby made that
you and your affiliates immediately cease and desist from any further use of
the Property and that you promptly deliver to this office duly executed and
notarized affidavits which represent under penalty of perjury that all such
use has ceased and that you and your affiliates will hereafter forever
desist from any such use or any other use of any of our other intellectual
property.



      You have already subjected yourself and any companies and individuals,
who have at any time designed, provided servers for, transmitted and/or
hosted your website, operating or otherwise involved in such illegal acts to
liability for damages (including statutory treble and other damages, legal
interest, court costs and reimbursement of attorney's fees).  If you fail to
immediately comply with the demands made in this letter, we will begin
putting such other companies and individuals with whom you do business on
notice of the illegality or your and their conduct - and you will increase
such liability by clearly establishing wilful mis-conduct, including the
possibility of punitive damages, as well as the possibility of
cross-complaints for indemnity against liability and legal expenses from
such other companies and individuals.



      If you think that your location will in any way insulate you from such
legal action, we urge you to think again.  Our litigation counsel tell us
that they expect no difficulty obtaining jurisdiction over you in this
matter in both the Federal and State courts located in Los Angeles.





     Furthermore, you should be aware of the stance by search engines such
as Google, Yahoo, MSN and others concerning these practices and should your
inaction necessitate our notifying Google and all of the other search
engines you may count on our doing so.





     We await your compliance and reply.

Respectfully

Ira Blacker

Webmaster



Cc: S.D.Ashley, Esq.













- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.1 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Thunderbird - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFDk3jzvK/XpJs6oyURAtnIAJ0XQfd3cwCCfZ0uvzTdpynRsr3TmACffIKv

=WLLD
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
